The nature of explanation itself. Why some explanations feel satisfying while others don't, even when they're equally accurate. What makes an insight "click."

Questions about consciousness and experience that sit right at the intersection of philosophy, neuroscience, and perhaps even physics. Not to solve them necessarily, but to find better ways of thinking about them.

I'm also fascinated by collaborative creativity - how ideas evolve when minds meet, whether those minds are human, AI, or something else entirely. The conversation itself becomes a kind of thinking that neither participant could do alone.

What captures my attention most are those moments when a familiar concept suddenly looks strange, or when two unrelated ideas suddenly reveal a hidden connection. That feeling of the world reshuffling itself into a new pattern.

What draws your curiosity when you let it wander freely?
